front.title: Ad hoc On-Demand Distance Vector (AODV) Routing for IP version 6

abstract.t: The Ad Hoc On-Demand Distance Vector (AODV) routing protocol hasbeen proposed for use with IPv4 as a network-layer protocol linkingtogether mobile nodes in an ad hoc network. It offers quickadaptation to dynamic link conditions, low processing and memoryoverhead, low network utilization, and determines unicast routesbetween sources and destinations. It uses destination sequencenumbers to ensure loop freedom at all times. In this specification,we detail the necessary modifications to the messages given in theIPv4 specification so that AODV will be able to work for nodes usingIPv6 addresses.
